AsyncTrigger

The AsyncTrigger class is used to fire an event at the timing of event delivery immediately after control returns to Kirikiri. This feature is called an asynchronous trigger.
In scripts that use an event-driven programming model like Kirikiri, it is useful when you want to perform processing outside of an event handler that cannot be executed within the handler itself (for example, attempting to invalidate the object that triggered the event from within its own handler).

Members

Constructor
AsyncTrigger
Methods
cancel ( Cancel trigger )
trigger ( Pull trigger )
Properties
cached ( Whether to cache events )
mode ( Mode )
